body.name: Trimui Smart Pro 5 inch Handheld Game Console Preinstalled Emulator System Retro Gray 64GB
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 15 hrs 19 mins
features: 4.96-inch IPS fully laminated screen: Clear and bright display, 1280x720 resolution. Provides an exciting gaming experience and enhanced eye protection.
Built-in 5000mAh large-capacity battery: Supports up to 5 hours of gaming. It will bring you a lot of happiness during your journey or long trip.
High Performance Emulator: Supports multiple simulators, more than 20 formats of games, and a large number of retro games. You can also download related format games by yourself to play.

Customized Linux System: It has the function of archiving and reading, searching for games, checking recently played games, collecting your favorite games, supporting dual controllers, and wifi online two-player battles.
Selected Classic Games by BSTXY: Trimui Smart Pro supports about 7000+ games which selected by BSTXY, please note.
Package List of EWDGOES: 1xTrimui Smart Pro Console Retro Gray 64GB Ver., 1xScreen Protector by BSTXY, 1xUSB-C Charge Cable, 1xInsctruction, 1xOfficial Pack Box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I felt like a kid on Christmas again.
reviews.reviewText: The Trimui Smart Pro 5-inch Handheld Game Console is a delightful mix of the old and new. Its design takes me back to those days of classic gaming, and I couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement when setting it up.Diving into the games was a treat. The console comes packed with a range of titles that brought back memories while also offering some new discoveries. It's evident that there's been attention to detail in curating this collection.The display is sharp and vibrant, making every game look great. The controls feel solid and responsive, which is essential for enjoying the gaming experience fully.One thing to keep in mind is that after a while of playing, the console does warm up a bit. It's not a deal-breaker for me, but it's something I noticed and thought others might want to know.All said and done, the Trimui Smart Pro is a fantastic handheld console for anyone looking to enjoy a mix of classic and modern games. It's fun, intuitive, and offers hours of entertainment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For the price, this is a well built system. 64gb card has a good amount of game preloaded, with one of my all time favorites! Aliens the arcade. The reason why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of a full 5, is this weird delay in charging. Also, it won't charge while you use it, which is also just an odd thing. There are no menu settings for button configurations that I can see or screen brightest etc. To me, these are pretty minor things. Overall, this is a very good system for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is so good. Missing some classics but you can order more games on a micro as on Ali Express etc. Super happy with it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I got this for my son for Christmas and it’s definitely been a hit with everyone. This thing comes preloaded with all your favorite blast from the past. So far everything when have played on it has ran great but the only thing I could say bad is that some big hit stuff like Mario cart wasn’t on there but! Simply connect the cord to the device and to a computer then go to the settings and select the SD card then from the computer simply open the storage then drag your favorite Roms to the correct folder. Super easy! This was worth every penny.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It’s pretty cool
reviews.reviewText: It’s cool overall I got this with the intention to give it to my mother in law who used to play when she was young however it didn’t have any Mario games except for a Mario bros bootleg so I decided to sell it to my brother. I’m aware you can add games to it but it’s not the simplest thing in the world. Compared to the xu10 which I also bought it’s more comfortable but the games installed to the xu10 were all out better. Both worked great out the box

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Game Play for a Multisystem Emulator - Digital Game History In your Hands
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I’ve logged over 40 hours on this unit because I wanted to test it thoroughly. If you are over the age of 40 you’ve seen 100s of “game systems” that are loaded with the classics and promise you a nostalgic experience. You may have even had a few around for you and your kids to resolve issues of gamer supremacy on Ms. Pac-man or Missile Command. Unfortunatetly most of those systems will fail in days and if they don’t then you find that the emulator or controls won’t work. The thing is most of those system retail for under 40 and are designed for a three pin monitor drive hookup. This system is the size and roughly the shape of the Switch and a number of other handheld game systems. It also has a higher price point (109) than the cheaper ‘Classic Game systems’ and boasts 68GB. I’m pleased to say that the price point is justified. The developers used not only stable emulators for all the games – some of which date back to the late 1970s (the Noid comes to mind as does Archon) – but have the proper controller combinations to allow you to play your favorites on a system that has the hand feel of those ancient machines of digital days past.An important note is A= select or go forward with the process B= go back and the triple Dotted menu button is where the search and access to other directories of the menu are to be found.The collection of games covers a little over 30 years of gaming history and the styles run from the simple pixel art of the 70s/80s to the graphics of the later Resident Evil installments for Gameboy and Xbox 360. Which brings up another important point. The gaming system shows you which emulator it is using for which games so that you can determine which switches/buttons are active for the game you are playing.The ultimate takeaway for this is that the system does outperform its cheaper competitors. It is not, at present, positioned as a direct challenge to any of the other new hand held gaming systems that work with proprietary titles and connect for online play. There is an online play option and there appears to be a great deal of expanded capacity for future title and emulator editions should they product head in that directions. The systems does have the capacity to save games so that you can work through campaigns without have to always start from the beginning which is for me the primary use of the available memory. For now if you are buying this as a gift it is for your hardcore gamer who likes to go back and play some classic arcade, home gaming systems, and handheld systems from 20 to 30 years ago. It is also a good gift for the person who keeps bragging about what kind of game they had back in the day. As someone who is as embarrassed by the quarters I fed into machines as a teen as I am about my performance playing Missile Command, Q*bert, Pac Man, Total Recall, and Resident Evil 3 on this I can attest to the fact that it is a chastening experience. Remembering how exactly you got to the point that you know which way to “click” a character to time a jump or which controller option gives you the most responsive play is an amazing kind of time travel.
You can play alot of retrogaming, but the 3D emulation have some diffulcties to play properly. The 2D games run with no difficultes. In conclusion, I recommended it.
